quote: We look forward to the time when the Power of Love will replace the Love of Power. Then will our world know the blessings of peace.
author: William Ewart Gladstone

quote: It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it.
author: Maurice Switzer

quote: For success, attitude is equally as important as ability.
author: Anonymous

quote: Either you run the day, or the day runs you.
author: Jim Rohn

quote: When I die, I want to go peacefully like my grandfather did–in his sleep. Not yelling and screaming like the passengers in his car.
author: Bob Monkhouse

quote: When I was 5 years old, my mother always told me that happiness was the key to life. When I went to school, they asked me what I wanted to be when I grew up. I wrote down “happy.” They told me I didn’t understand the assignment, and I told them they didn’t understand life.
author: Anonymous

quote: Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed citizens can change the world. Indeed, it’s the only thing that ever has.
author: Margaret Mead

quote: People are illogical, unreasonable, and self-centered. Love them anyway.
author: Kent M. Keith

quote: Absence diminishes mediocre passions and increases great ones, as the wind blows out candles and fans fire.
author: François (VI) (Duc de La Rochefoucauld)

quote: The next time you’re faced with something that’s unexpected, unwanted and uncertain, consider that it just may be a gift.
author: Stacey Kramer

quote: To avoid criticism, say nothing, do nothing, be nothing.
author: Fred Shero

quote: A baby is God’s opinion that life should go on.
author: Carl Sandburg

quote: If opportunity doesn’t knock, build a door.
author: Milton Berle

quote: I believe in the sacredness of a promise, that a man’s word should be as good as his bond; that character — not wealth or power or position — is of supreme worth.
author: John D. Rockefeller (Jr.)

quote: Everything in moderation, including moderation.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Worry is like a rocking chair, it will give you something to do, but it won’t get you anywhere.
author: Vance Havner

quote: I asked God for a bike, but I know God doesn’t work that way. So I stole a bike and asked for forgiveness.
author: Emo Philips

quote: I was out on a date recently and the guy took me horseback riding. That was kind of fun, until we ran out of quarters.
author: Susie Loucks

quote: The world is my country, all mankind are my brethren and to do good is my religion.
author: Thomas Paine

quote: I don’t feel threatened by people who ask questions. It’s those who refuse to answer them that frighten me.
author: Jason Bacchetta

quote: Just taught my kids about taxes by eating 38% of their ice cream.
author: Conan O’Brien

quote: Wise men speak because they have something to say; fools because they have to say something.
author: Plato

quote: My therapist told me the way to achieve true inner peace is to finish what I start. So far I’ve finished two bags of M&Ms and a chocolate cake. I feel better already.
author: Dave Barry

quote: The trouble with eating Italian food is that five or six days later, you’re hungry again.
author: George Miller

quote: Life expectancy would grow by leaps and bounds if green vegetables smelled as good as bacon.
author: Doug Larson

quote: The odds of going to the store for a loaf of bread and coming out with only a loaf of bread are three billion to one.
author: Erma Bombeck

quote: Instead of getting married again, I’m going to find a woman I don’t like and just give her a house.
author: Rod Stewart

quote: Patriotism is supporting your country all the time, and your government when it deserves it.
author: Mark Twain

quote: All our dreams can come true, if we have the courage to pursue them.
author: Walt Disney

quote: As a well-spent day brings happy sleep, so a life well spent brings happy death.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

quote: Always borrow money from a pessimist. He won’t expect it back.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Courage is contagious. When a brave man takes a stand, the spines of others are stiffened.
author: Billy Graham

quote: Patience is something you admire in the driver behind you, but not in one ahead.
author: Bill McGlashen

quote: Men reach their sexual peak at eighteen. Women reach theirs at thirty-five. Do you get the feeling that God is playing a practical joke?
author: Rita Rudner

quote: I dream of a better tomorrow, where chickens can cross the road and not be questioned about their motives.
author: Anonymous

quote: Not everything that can be counted counts, and not everything that counts can be counted.
author: William Bruce Cameron

quote: I never took a day off in my twenties. Not one.
author: Bill Gates

quote: Perfection is not attainable, but if we chase perfection we can catch excellence.
author: Vince Lombardi

quote: What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what lies within us.
author: Henry S. Haskins

quote: How wonderful it is that nobody need wait a single moment before beginning to improve the world.
author: Anne Frank

quote: It is the mark of an educated mind to be able to entertain a thought without accepting it.
author: Aristotle

quote: The same fence that shuts others out shuts you in.
author: Bill Copeland

quote: Waiting for perfect is never as smart as making progress.
author: Seth Godin

quote: I couldn’t repair your brakes, so I made your horn louder.
author: Steven Wright

quote: America is a country where half the money is spent buying food, and the other half is spent trying to lose weight.
author: Anonymous

quote: You see things; and you say “Why?” But I dream things that never were; and I say “Why not?”
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: I have never in my life learned anything from any man who agreed with me.
author: Dudley Field Malone

quote: We’ve all heard that a million monkeys banging on a million typewriters will eventually reproduce the entire works of Shakespeare. Now, thanks to the Internet, we know this is not true.
author: Robert Wilensky

quote: Little minds are tamed and subdued by misfortune; but great minds rise above them.
author: Washington Irving

quote: What you do speaks so loudly that I cannot hear what you say.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: People who read the tabloids deserve to be lied to.
author: Jerry Seinfeld

quote: Every truth passes through three stages before it is recognized. In the first, it is ridiculed. In the second, it is opposed. In the third, it is regarded as self-evident.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: No man is rich enough to buy back his past.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: A successful man is one who makes more money than his wife can spend. A successful woman is one who can find such a man.
author: Lana Turner

quote: I always arrive late at the office, but I make up for it by leaving early.
author: Charles Lamb

quote: Do not pray for easy lives. Pray to be stronger men! Do not pray for tasks equal to your powers. Pray for powers equal to your tasks!
author: Phillips Brooks

quote: The conductor of an orchestra doesn’t make a sound. He depends, for his power, on his ability to make other people powerful.
author: Benjamin Zander

quote: To the world you may be just one person, but to one person you may be the world.
author: Brandi Snyder

quote: What we are is God’s gift to us. What we become is our gift to God.
author: Eleanor Powell

quote: The only way the French are going in is if we tell them we found truffles in Iraq.
author: Dennis Miller

quote: I have to exercise early in the morning before my brain figures out what I’m doing.
author: Anonymous

quote: Why does a woman work ten years to change a man’s habits and then complain that he’s not the man she married?
author: Barbra Streisand

quote: Life shrinks or expands in proportion to one’s courage.
author: Anaïs Nin

quote: I knew a man who gave up smoking, drinking, sex, and rich food. He was healthy right up to the day he killed himself.
author: Johnny Carson

quote: My mother never saw the irony in calling me a son-of-a-bitch.
author: Jack Nicholson

quote: Misers aren’t fun to live with, but they make wonderful ancestors.
author: David Brenner

quote: Insanity is hereditary. You get it from your children.
author: Sam Levenson

quote: It’s useless to hold a person to anything he says while he’s in love, drunk, or running for office.
author: Shirley MacLaine

quote: It wasn’t raining when Noah built the ark.
author: Howard Ruff

quote: The elevator to success is out of order. You’ll have to use the stairs . . . one step at a time.
author: Joe Girard

quote: Never tell your problems to anyone . . . 20% don’t care and the other 80% are glad you have them.
author: Lou Holtz

quote: There’s zero correlation between being the best talker and having the best ideas.
author: Susan Cain

quote: It is not fair to ask of others what you are unwilling to do yourself.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: Bisexuality immediately doubles your chances for a date on Saturday night.
author: Rodney Dangerfield

quote: Let the wife make the husband glad to come home, and let him make her sorry to see him leave.
author: Martin Luther

quote: I am only one; but still I am one. I cannot do everything; but still I can do something; and because I cannot do everything, I will not refuse to do the something that I can do.
author: Edward Everett Hale

quote: Failure is the condiment that gives success its flavor.
author: Truman Capote

quote: A lie can travel half way around the world while the truth is putting on its shoes.
author: Mark Twain

quote: An archaeologist is the best husband a woman can have; the older she gets the more interested he is in her.
author: Agatha Christie

quote: In dreams and in love there are no impossibilities.
author: János Arany

quote: He, who will not reason, is a bigot; he, who cannot, is a fool; and he, who dares not, is a slave.
author: William Drummond

quote: Illegal aliens have always been a problem in the United States. Ask any Indian.
author: Robert Orben

quote: The most difficult years of marriage are those following the wedding.
author: Bethany Austin

quote: Don’t smother each other. No one can grow in the shade.
author: Leo Buscaglia

quote: Politicians and diapers have one thing in common. They should both be changed regularly, and for the same reason.
author: José Maria de Eça de Queiroz

quote: At every party, there are two kinds of people–those who want to go home and those who don’t. The trouble is, they are usually married to each other.
author: Ann Landers

quote: Those people who think they know everything are a great annoyance to those of us who do.
author: Isaac Asimov

quote: If you have knowledge, let others light their candles in it.
author: Margaret Fuller

quote: The best way to predict the future is to invent it.
author: Alan Kay

quote: If not us, who? If not now, when?
author: Hillel the Elder

quote: You know you’re getting old when you stoop to tie your shoelaces and wonder what else you could do while you’re down there.
author: George Burns

quote: For it was not into my ear you whispered, but into my heart. It was not my lips you kissed, but my soul.
author: Judy Garland

quote: When opportunity knocks, some people are in the backyard looking for four-leaf clovers.
author: Polish Proverb

quote: A bargain is something you don’t need at a price you can’t resist.
author: Franklin Jones

quote: Enjoy the little things, for one day you may look back and realize they were the big things.
author: Robert Brault

quote: Remember that happiness is a way of travel, not a destination.
author: Roy L. Goodman

quote: We live in a society where pizza gets to your house before the police.
author: Anonymous

quote: The most dangerous poison is the feeling of achievement. The antidote is to every evening think what can be done better tomorrow.
author: Ingvar Kamprad

quote: The only thing worse than being blind is having sight but no vision.
author: Helen Keller

quote: There are two primary choices in life: to accept conditions as they exist, or accept the responsibility for changing them.
author: Denis Waitley
